requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
user_persona: A risk analyst who needs up-to-date information for her assessments.
user_goal: To load the latest risk items and related data dynamically when accessing the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Sarah logs in and lands on the dashboard, expecting to see updated risk items loaded automatically.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the dashboard after successful login.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard loads with no hardcoded data, making API calls to populate risk item lists and charts.

requirement_tested: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_goal: To confirm the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Developer starts the backend service and monitors logs for database connection messages.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server initializes successfully and establishes a connection to PostgreSQL using provided environment variables.

requirement_tested: User authentication and subscription management system
user_persona: A new user signing up for a trial subscription.
user_goal: To sign up, choose a subscription tier, and gain access to premium features.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks the login button to access the authentication flow.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the authentication page with options to sign in or register.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Subscription Tier
narrative_steps.description: After registering, Jamie selects the 'Pro' subscription tier to unlock full features.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Redirected to the checkout flow managed by the external payment provider.

user_persona: A compliance officer conducting a quarterly review.
user_goal: To select multiple risk items quickly using search and filtering.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Risk Item Selector
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the risk item checklist to begin her assessment.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List of risk items fetched from the backend and displayed with steel blue styling.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Items
narrative_steps.description: She searches for 'cybersecurity' to narrow down the list.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'cybersecurity' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List filters in real-time to show only matching risk items.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting an Item
narrative_steps.description: Morgan selects a relevant cybersecurity item to add to her current assessment.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a filtered risk item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Item is added to the active assessment set, triggering data auto-population.

requirement_tested: Auto-population of risk assessment data from database
user_persona: A junior auditor reviewing pre-filled risk data.
user_goal: To verify that selecting a risk item auto-fills accurate data from the database.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Risk Item
narrative_steps.description: Riley selects a known risk item from the list.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a risk item in the checklist.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Relevant data fields below the selector update with pre-filled values fetched from the backend.

requirement_tested: Chart generation based on selected risk assessment items
user_persona: A project manager preparing visuals for a stakeholder meeting.
user_goal: To generate a visual representation of selected risks for presentation purposes.

narrative_steps.title: Generating Charts
narrative_steps.description: Patricia has selected several risk items and now wants to visualize them.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Chart is rendered in the canvas area, displaying data from selected risk items.

user_persona: An executive needing a shareable summary of findings.
user_goal: To compile and export a risk assessment report in PDF format.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Report
narrative_steps.description: Alex finalizes his selections and wants to generate a formal report.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Create Report' button and select '.pdf' format.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: System generates a formatted PDF report and initiates browser download.

requirement_tested: Database schema design to support risk assessment data
user_persona: A database administrator ensuring correct schema deployment.
user_goal: To validate that the database contains properly structured tables for risk data.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Database Tables
narrative_steps.description: DBA inspects the deployed database to ensure all necessary tables exist.
narrative_steps.action: Query the database for existence of tables: users, risk_items, reports, subscriptions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All required tables are present with correct column structures and relationships.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for fetching risk assessment items and related data
user_persona: A frontend engineer integrating risk data into the UI.
user_goal: To consume risk item data from backend API endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Risk Items
narrative_steps.description: Engineer makes a GET request to retrieve the list of risk items.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Receive a JSON response containing a list of risk items with id, name, category, etc.

requirement_tested: User interface with alice blue background and steel blue components
user_persona: A designer validating brand consistency across the app.
user_goal: To confirm that the UI follows the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting UI Colors
narrative_steps.description: Designer inspects the homepage to verify background and component colors.
narrative_steps.action: View homepage and inspect CSS styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site background is alice blue (#F0F8FF) and interactive components use steel blue (#4682B4).

requirement_tested: Subscription feature to control access to risk assessment tools
user_persona: A free-tier user attempting to use premium features.
user_goal: To attempt to perform a restricted action and be prompted to upgrade.

narrative_steps.title: Trying Premium Feature
narrative_steps.description: Free-tier user Noah tries to start a new risk assessment.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to initiate a new risk assessment without a valid subscription.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal appears prompting Noah to upgrade to access the feature.

requirement_tested: Data visualization components for displaying risk charts
user_persona: A data scientist analyzing trends visually.
user_goal: To explore chart data interactively through tooltips.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Chart
narrative_steps.description: Quinn hovers over a segment of the generated chart to get more details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltip appears showing numeric value and contextual label for that segment.

user_persona: An admin maintaining company-wide report standards.
user_goal: To update an existing report template used across the organization.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Template
narrative_steps.description: Admin navigates to the template management section and edits a template.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Edit' button next to an existing report template.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Template editor opens, allowing modifications to the structure and content.

requirement_tested: User dashboard for managing assessments and reports
user_persona: A frequent user organizing her daily tasks.
user_goal: To access recent assessments and reports from the centralized dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Using Dashboard Widgets
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on a widget showing recent assessments to view details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a dashboard widget titled 'Recent Assessments'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Widget expands to show a detailed list of recent assessments with quick action links.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development setup with npm scripts for installation and execution
user_persona: A new developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies and run both frontend and backend services.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Developer runs the command to install all project dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed successfully.

narrative_steps.title: Running Services
narrative_steps.description: Developer starts both services simultaneously for local development.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend services start concurrently, ready for development.
